item.description:
February 1. Steaming in company with ships of Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO on night retirement West of Nasugbu Cove. (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO = Rear Admiral FECHTELER in CGC SPENCER). While returning into cove in the morning, SAUFLEY intercepted a Japanese "Q" Boat which she destroyed with main battery at 0801, Ammunition expended, 69 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common, 275 rounds of 40M/M and 150 rounds of 20M/M. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 033 of l February 1945).

At 1039 commenced fire support mission. Fire support mission completed at 1100, No results observed. No casualties. Ammunition expended, 63 rounds 5"/38 AA Common. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 033 of 1 February 1945). Upon completion of firing SAUFLEY commenced screening to seaward of transport area.

Several torpedo boats approached from South at 2315. As boats did not identify themselves in any way, screening ships in vicinity opened fire. One boat observed to burst into flames at 2320 and the other shortly afterwards.

February 2. Sereening to seaward of Nasugbu Cove transport area Luzon, Philippine Islands, (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO - Rear Admiral FECHTELER in CGC SPENCER). At 0310 Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO took departure from Nasugbu for Mindoro in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO dispatch 010715. SAUFLEY in anti-submarine screen, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO in CGC SPENCER with USS LOUGH as escort departed and proceeded ahead independently leaving Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT EIGHT (Captain COLE in USS FLUSSER) as Officer in Tactical Command.

At 1726 SAUFLEY directed by Officer in Tactical Command to proceed independently. Entered Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands and anchored at 1821. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT NINETEEN at Caminawit Point),

February 3. Anchored in Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT NINETEEN at Caminawit Point). During the day SAUFLEY underway to fuel and obtain ammunition and returned to anchorage at 1615.
February 4-5. Anchored in Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT NINETEEN at Caminawit Point).

February 6. Anchored in Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT NINETEEN at Caminawit Point). At 1713 underway in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO speedletter 0007A and formed Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FOURTEEN composed of LSM's 36, 205, 217 and 127 and FS's 184 and 309. Screen composed of USS SUESSENS and USS SAUFLEY (Officer in Tactical Command). Took departure from Mindoro for Nasugbu at 1820,

February 7. Steaming enroute from Mindoro, Philippine Islands to Nasugbu, Luzon, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FOURTEEN (Officer in Tactical Command in USS SAUFLEY). Arrived Nasugbu about 0900 and commenced screening to seaward of the LSM's after they were beached. During the afternoon eight army casualties were brought on board for transportation to Mindoro. At 2115 reformed Task Unit, Less FS184 and FS309 and took departure from Nasugbu for Mindoro,

February 8. Steaming enroute from Nasugbu, Luzon, Philippine Islands to Mindoro, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FOURTEEN (Officer in Tactical Command in USS SAUFLEY). Arrived Mangarin Bay, Mindoro about 1015. Task Unit dissolved at 1019 and LSM's proceeded independently. SAUFLEY anchored off White Beach at 1148 and transferred army casualties to beach. Proceeded to fuel at 1319 and upon completion anchored in berth 116 Mangarin Bay.

At 1753 underway in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO dispatch 080245 to join Task Unit SEVENTY SEVEN POINT THREE POINT TWO composed of USS DENVER (Officer in Tactical Command - Rear Admiral BERKEY), USS MONTPELIER and USS BOISE plus screening destroyers, USS FLETCHER, USS LAVALETTE, USS RADFORD, USS ABBOTT, USS TAYLOR, USS CONYNGHAI, USS CLAXTON and USS SAUFLEY. Took departure from Mindoro for Subic Bay at 1854, At 2045 USS CLEVELAND escorted by USS JENKINS and USS O'BANNON joined this Task Unit.

February 9. Steaming enroute from Mindoro, Philippine Islands to Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY SEVEN POINT THREE POINT TWO (Officer in Tactical Command - Rear Admiral BERKEY in USS DENVER). In the morning screened to seaward as the cruisers entered Subic Bay. SAUFLEY entered Subic Bay and anchored at 1034 reporting to Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE for duty in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO dispatch 080245.
February 10. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT PODINT THREE - Rear Admiral STRUBLE in CGC INGHAM).

February 11. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE - Rear Admiral STRUBLE in CGC INGHAM). At O800 assumed ready duty.

Februaryy 12. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands, (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE - Rear Admiral STRUBLE in CGC INGHAM). Relieved of ready duty at 0800. Lieutenant Commander Francis William SILK, 81211, USN, relieved Commander Dale Eugene COCHRAN, 75016, USN, as Commanding Officer this date. At 1200 Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE assumed duties as Senior Officer Present Afloat.

February 13. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE). Underway at 1710 in accordance with Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FILVE mailgram 120800 of 12 February 1945. At 1818 relieved USS CLAXTON on anti-submarine patrol station Able.

February 14. Patrolling on anti-submarine station Able off entrance to Subic Bay. USS LESLIE B KNOX relieved SAUFLEY on station at 1745. At 1835 joined Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE agnd took station in anti-submarine screen, (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE Rear Adymiral Struble in CGC INGHAM). This Task Group enroute to Manila Bay area for landings at Mariveles, Bataan Peninsula and Corregidor Island.

February 15. Steaming enroute from Subic Bay to Manila Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE - Rear Admiral STRUBLE in CGC INGHAM). At 0857 SAUIFLEY proceeded to assigned screening station for the landing operation in Mariveles Harbor. At 1023 directed by Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE to join USS CONYNGHAM in screening Miine sweeps as they swept South Channel. Fired counter battery fire on Caballo Island at 1134 and again at 1641. No results observed. Ammunition expended: 50 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common and 140 rounds of 40M/M. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

In accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE operation order 4-45, USS CLAXTON and USS SAUFLEY operated in area South of Bataan and West of LaMonja Island commencing at dark conducting interdiction fire on Mariveles and as support for own MTB's operating inside Manila Bay.

February 16. Steaming in area South of Bataan Peninsula and West of LaMonja Island in company with USS CLAXTON (Officer in Tactical Command), conducting interdiction fire on Mariveles and acting as support for own MTB's operating inside Manila Bay. At 0050 relieved USS CLAXTON as firing ship. Ceased firing at 0340 when possible Japanese "Q" Boat was reported close aboard and maneuvered to evade. Ammunition expended: 24 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

Patrolled with USS CONVERSE until 0759 when directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE to join CGC INGHAM in company with USS CONYNGHAM and provide screen for the assault group moving from Mariveles Harbor to the landing beach on the South side of Corregidor Island. Commenced lying to off landing beach at 1000 as a stand by fire support ship. 1800 proceeded from Corregidor to Mariveles Harbor with CGC INGHAM.

At 2100 departed Mariveles in company with USS CONVERSE screening 6 LST's and 7 LSM's enroute to Subic Bay.

February 17. Steaming enroute from Mariveles Harbor, Bataan Peninsula to Subic Bay, Luzon Island with USS CONVERSS providing anti-submarine screen for 6 LST's and 7 LSM's. At 0246 anchored in Subic Bay. In accordance with verbal orders of Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE underway at 0627 as escort for 6 LSM's to Mariveles Harbor. Arrived Mariveles at 1000 and commenced patrolling to Southward awaiting LSM's.

In accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE visual dispatch 170140 joined USS CONYNGHAM at 1145 and proceeded to Subic Bay. Rendezvoused with 5 APD's off Subic Bay at 1445 and screened them enroute to Corregidor Island. Arrived Corregidor at 1633 and detached from APD group.

At 1835 with USS CONYNGHAM formed screen for CGC INGHAM proceeding from Corregidor to Mariveles as directed verbally by Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE. Departed from Mariveles for Subic Bay at 1908 escorting CGC INGHAM and 6 APD's.

At 2131 anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands.

February 18. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT - Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE. At 0358 underway and went alongside USS WINOOSKI to fuel. At 0553 underway and proceeded to Corregidor. Arrived Corregidor at 0805 and assumed duties as fire support ship in company with USS CONVERSE (Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE - Commander Destroyer Division FORTY SIX). Proceeded to North Channel off Morrison Point at 0905 as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE. At 0952 commenced firing on assigned target. Ceased firing at 1000 having expended 200 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition. No casualties. Results reported excellent by shore fire control observer, (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Fired on beached Japanese landing barge at 1405. No casualties. Ammunition expended: 25 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common and 310 rounds of 40M/M. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

At 1342 directed by Shore Fire Control Party to patrol close to beach and find targets of opportunity. At 1402 near-miss about 10 yards off port beam amidships caused minor dam- age from several small fragments. No casualties. Commenced firing on points of possible origin of the fire. Observed five more splashes in water approximately 50 yards off port bow as ship turned to starboard. Checked fire at 1415 and then fired at intervals on targets of opportunity or possible hidden gun positions. Ceased firing at 1445 having expended 136 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition; 1539 rounds of 4OM/M; and 261 rounds of 20M/M. No casualties. No results observed, (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

Fired 50 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition at target designated by shore fire control party at 1511. No casualties. No results observed. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

At 1640 Sunk abandoned Japanese "Q" Boat by 40M/M fire

At 1718 observed and felt six large underwater explosions in a definite pattern approximately 500 yards astern of USS CONVERSE who had just passed approximately 1000 yards North of SAUFLEY on course East at an estimated speed of 15 knots. These explosions believed to be Japanese controlled mines. Point of the explosions was approximately 2500 yards due North of Morrison Point. No damage to either ship.

At 1833 retired from North Channel proceeded to Westward of Corregidor and commenced patrolling on courses generally North and South. Commenced night harassing illumination of Corregidor at 1943 as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE.

February 19. Patrolling West of Corregidor in company with USS CONVERSE (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE) conducting harassing starshell illumination of Corregidor. At 0123 observed large explosion on Corregidor. Believed to be an ammunition dump. Completed illumination mission at 0645 having expended 47 starshells. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

Assumed fire support station off Breakwater Point at 0800. Commenced firing on assigned targets at 1037. At 1215 ceased firing having expended 266 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. ammunition. No casualties. Results reported excellent by Shore Fire Control spotter. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). USS DYSON and USS THATCHER relieved USS CONVERSE and USS SAUFLEY at 1215.

Proceeded to Subic Bay and arrived at 1500. Upon entering SAUFLEY fueled and obtained ammunition.

February 20. In Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands obtaining logistics. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT - Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE). Anchored in berth #165 at 0010.

At 1019 underway and sortied in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE visual dispatch 192345. Returned to Subic Bay at 1123 as directed verbally by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE and anchored.

February 21. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT - Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE). At 0515 underway in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE dispatch 200845 and escorted LSM311 to Mariveles Harbor. Arrived Mariveles Harbor at 0855 and LSM proceeded into harbor. SAUFLEY commenced patrolling in vicinity of LaMonja Island. At 0940 relieved USS DYSON of fire support duty in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE dispatch 200845. Took station one mile West of Wheeler Point, Corregidor Island and lay to. Between 1315 and 1527 fired at targets on Wheeler and Searchlight Points as directed by shore fire control party. Results reported excellent. Ammunition expended: 119 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Upon completion of firing, patrolled on various courses approximately two miles West of Corregidor. Observed large explosion in vicinity of Malinta Hill at 2130. Commenced firing starshells over Malinta Hill at 2133 as requested by shore fire control party. Ceased illuminating at 2140 having expended 8 starshells. (See SAUFIEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Commenced lying to as fire cover for USS CONVERSE and two MTB's closing beach to rescue army personnel cut off by enemy on the beach.

February 22. Lying to South of Corregidor Island, Manila Bay, Philippine Islands, as fire support for USS CONVERSE and two MTB's attempting to evacuate Army personnel cut off by landslide on the beach. (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE in USS CONVERSE). Commenced patrolling South of Corregidor at 0200, Between 0504 and 0703 fired 18 starshells as requested by shore fire control party. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Resumed patrol at 0705. At 0925 commenced lying to one mile South of Searchlight Point. Between 0955 and 1920 fired on designated targets on Searchlight, Wheeler and Unidentified Points. Results reported very good. Ammunition expended 980 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLZY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). At 1921 commenced patrolling South of LaMonja Island. Took station astern of USS CONVERSE at 2100.

February 23. Steaming on patrol three miles West of Corregidor Island, Manila Bay, Philippine Islands, astern of USS CONVERSE (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE). At 0312 commenced lying to two miles Southwest of Caballo Island and firing air bursts into area 800 yards East of Malinta Hill. Ceased firing at 0421 having expended 130 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition. No casualties. Results undetermined. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of February 27, 1945). Commenced patrolling four miles South of Corregidor. USS CLAXTON relieved SAUFLEY of fire support duty at 0818 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE dispatch 220910. SAUFLEY departed for Subic Bay in accordance with same dispatch and also as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE. Entered Subic Bay at 1030 took on amnunition, fueled, and anchored in berth #146 at 1756.

February 24. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task force SEVENTY EIGHT Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE). Underway at 0353 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE mailgram 231054. Proceeded out of Subic Bay and escorted six LSM's to Mariveles Harbor as Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FORTY ONE. Arrived Mariveles at 0812 and LSM's entered harbor, SAUFLEY patrolling to seaward. At 1000 screened four LSM's from Mariveles to Black Beach, Corregidor. At 1259 reformed Task Unit and departed for Subic Bay. Arrived Subic Bay at 1610 and anchored in berth #146 at 1657.

February 25. Anchored in Subic Bay, Philippine Islands, Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT - Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE. Underway at 0350, reformed Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FORTY ONE, and departed for Mariveles. Arrived Black Beach, Corregidor at 0800, and sent LSM's in to beach. 1120 relieved by USS THATCHER as Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FORTY ONE and relieved USS THATCHER of fire support duty in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE dispatch 241303. Took station 1500 yards East of Hooker Point at 1220 and commenced lying to. Fired on abandoned Jap barge on beach at 1305 with heavy machine guns. Ceased firing at 1309 having expended 380 rounds of 40M/M ammunition. No casualties. Barge destroyed. (See SAUPLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Entered Caballo Bay and anchored 600 yards South of Mankey Point, at 1408. At 1430, commenced neutralizing bombardment with USS CONVERSE in preparation for advancing troops. Ceased firing at 1445, having expended 244 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition. No casualties. Results reported excellent by Shore Fire Control Party. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). At 1515 commenced firing harassing fire off Hooker Point and Eastern end of Corregidor. Ceased firing at 1550 having expended 50 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition. No casualties. Results satisfactory. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Proceeded out Caballo Bay at 1950, and commenced patrolling astern of USS CONVERSE South of LaMonja Island.

February 26. Steaming astern of USS CONVERSE (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE) on patrol South of LaMonja Island, Manila Bay, Philippine Islands. At 0520, observed MTB's strafing Japs in water near LaMonja Island. Shifted patrol to entrance of Caballo Bay at 0715. USS CONVERSE proceeded into bay. At 0815, SAUFLEY relieved USS CONVERSE on station and anchored 550 yards South of Monkey Point, Caballo Bay. Sniped at Japs with rifles. At 1050, observed and felt very heavy explosion inland from Monkey Point. Numerous casualties apparent among own troops. At 1106, commenced firing on designated targets on Eastern end of Corregidor. Ceased firing at 1225 having expended 53 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition and 1 round of Common. No casualties. Results reported good. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

Underway at 1314, and proceeded out of Caballo Bay. Departed for Subic Bay at 1700. Entered Subic Bay at 1835, fueled, and anchored at 2031. Reported to Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT for duty.

February 27. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT - Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE). Underway during morning to fuel and obtain dry provisions. Returned to anchorage at 1239.

Underway at 1903 in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT dispatch 270638 and proceeded out of Subic Bay. Took departure for Mindoro, Philippine Islands at 1921.

February 28. Steaming enroute from Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands, to Mindoro, Philippine Islands. Arrived Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands at 0710, fueled, and anchored at 0910. Reported to Commander LCI Flotillas for duty in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT dispatch 260229 and formed Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT NINE POINT SEVEN. At 1610, took departure from Mindoro for Lubang Island, Philippine Islands.

source.name: USS SAUFLEY - Rep of ops in the invasion of Basilan Is, Philippines on 3/16/45
USS SAUFLEY - Rep of shore bombardment & A/S act in Ormoc Bay, Leyte Is, Philippines, night of 11/27-28/44
USS SAUFLEY - Rep of ops in support of the invaison of Zamboanga Peninsula, Mindanao Is, Philippines 3/10-16/45

item.description: October 1-5 Moored alongside U.S.S. JOHNSON in Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. Emergency repairs being accomplished by U.S.S. DIXIE. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in U.S.S. NASHVILLE).

October 6 Moored alongside U.S.S. JOHNSON in Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in U.S.S. NASHVILLE).

Underway at 1116 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 030237 and proceeded up Whangpoo River to Standard Oil Dock. River Pilot on board. Fueled during afternoon. Entered Yangtze River at 1534. Transferred Pilot at 1810. Took station astern of U.S.S. ROBINSON at 1933 and proceeded to Fatu Anchorage, China.

October 7 Steaming enroute from Shanghai, China to Fatu Anchorage, China in company with U.S.S. ROBINSON (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO).

Entered Vernon Channel entrance to Fatu Anchorege at 0604. Anchored one mile Southeast of Tinghai Harbor at 0820. During the afternoon, Lieutenant Commander SILK relieved Commander THOMPSON, Commanding Officer of U.S.S. WALLER, as Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE. His basic mission was to assist the Chinese on Tinghai Island in securing the Japanese forces, so as to render the Fatu Channel safe for passage of a convoy by 10 October 1945. In accomplishing this mission it was considered necessary to concentrate all Japanese in concentration camps under armed guards, to remove all breeches to heavy guns which could not be moved, to disarm all suicide boats (already accomplished), and to concentrate and establish Chinese control over all Japanese arms and munitions.

YMS 197 moored alongside at 1920.

October 8 Anchored one mile Southeast of Tinghai Harbor in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. YMS 197 alongside. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY)

Lieutenant Commander SILK prepared and presented to the Governor, in Tinghai, for approval, and to the Japanese commander to obey, an order requiring the Japanese Commander to concentrate all his forces immediately in the Fishing School Buildings and the Airstrip Buildings on Chusan Island. The Chinese took charge of Japanese arms and munitions. An inspection was made of all magazines and warehouses.

October 9 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. YMS 197 alongside. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY)

Under the supervision of U.S.S. SAUFLEY officers, the Japanese moved to their concentration camp. The naval battery on Matsen Island was inspected and demobilized.

YMS 197 underway in the afternoon and anchored in Tinghai Harbor.

October 10 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY)

Basic mission was accomplished, It was considered that the Fatu Channel inland approaches were secure.

October 11 - 13 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY)

During the three day period, the Japanese concentration camps and several outlying posts were inspected by Lieutenant Commander SILK and the Governor.

October 14 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

Lieutenant Commander SILK exchanged calls with Commander YANG, CN, who arrived this date to take charge of all naval installations.

October 15 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

An inspection was made of all captured naval installations, including the Japanese Garrison, by Commander YANG and Lieutenant Commander SILK.

October 16 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

October 17 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

Underway at 0809 to rendezvous with mine sweepers of Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE. Anchored at 1230 North of Tong Ting Island. Underway at 1445 to return to anchor- age at Tinghai. Anchored at 1819 in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China.

October 18 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

Underway at 0814 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 171343 of October 1945. At 1155 joined U.S.S. STARLING, U.S.S. COMPETENT, and YMS 197 in area North of Tong Ting Island. Took station astern of minesweepers as demolition vessel. Anchored at 1958 North of Tong Ting Island.

October 19 Anchored North of Tong Ting Island, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

October 19 Anchored North of Tong Ting Island, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

Underway at 0844 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 191428 of October 1945, in company with YMS 197. Anchored at 1732 in Yangtze River mouth.
October 21 - 22 Anchored in Yangtze River mouth, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

October 23 Anchored in Yangtze River mouth, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

During the afternoon K. KRISTENSEN, civilian pilot, reported on board. Shifted anchorage to Fairy Flats, South Channel, Yangtze River.

October 24 Anchored in Fairy Flats, South Channel, Yangtze River, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

Underway at 0606 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 230514 of October 1945. Proceeding to Quarantine anchorage. Fueled during the morning. Anchored at 1258 in Quarantine anchorage, Yangtze River.

October 25 Anchored in Quarantine anchorage, Yangtze River, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander ILSEMANN in U.S.S. MONONGAHELA.)

Underway at 0933 in accordance with instructions from Commanding Officer of U.S.S. DIXIE. Entered Whangpoo River at 0953 and proceeded to Shanghai. At 1207 moored to U.S.S. DIXIE between buoys number seven (7) and number eight (8) in the Whangpoo River, Shanghai.

October 26-31 Moored alongsids U.S.S. DIXIE in Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. Emergency repairs being accomplished by U.S.S. DIXIE. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Rear Admiral JOY in U.S.S. NASHVILLE.)

September 1 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST. LOUIS).

Underway at 0757 in accordance with Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO Underway Training Exercise Schedule for 1 September 1945. Proceeding in company with USS ROBINSON (Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO), USS WALLER, and USS PHILIP. Conducted tactical exercises while enroute to firing area, During the morning conducted sleeve firing exercises consisting of runs. Upon completion of firing resumed tactical exercises. During the afternoon conducted Sleeve firing exercises consisting of runs. Upon completion of firing proceeded to Subic Bay, conducting tactical exercises enroute. Stood into Subic Bay at 1622 and proceeded to fuel. Anchored at 1832.
September 2 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST. LOUIS).

September 3 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST. LOUIS).

Underway at 1658 in accordance with Commander Task force SEVENTY THREE visual orders. Sortied from harbor entrance at 1720 and conducted anti-submarine search. At 1743 formed Task Force SEVENTY THREE consisting of USS ST. LOUIS (Officer in Tactical Command, CAPTAIN GRIGGS) and USS NASHVILLE screened by USS ROBINSON (Screen Commander, Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO, CAPTAIN CAMPBELL), USS WALLER, and USS SAUFLEY. Enroute to Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima.

September 4 Steaming enroute from Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands to Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima in company with Task Force SEVENTY THREE, consisting of USS ST. LOUIS (Officer in Tactical Command, CAPTAIN GRIGGS), USS NASHVILLE, USS ROBINSON (Screen Commander, Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO, CAPTAIN CAMPBELL), USS WALLER, and USS SAUFLEY.

During the morning test fired VT fuzed projectiles, At 1237 USS ROBINSON left formation to proceed independently to destination in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE visual dispatch 040314. Commander THOMPSON in USS WALLER assumed duty as screen commander.

September 5 Steaming enroute from Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands to Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima in company with Task Force SEVENTY THREE, consisting of USS ST. LOUIS (Officer in Tactical Command, CAPTAIN GRIGGS), USS NASHVILLE, USS WALLER (Screen Commander, Commander THOMPSON), and USS SAUFLEY.

During the morning conducted exercise TWO (2) Able Modified in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE visual dispatch 040438.

September 6 Steaming enroute from Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands to Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima in company with Task Force SEVENTY THREE, consisting of USS ST. LOUIS (Officer in Tactical Command, CAPTAIN GRIGGS), USS NASHVILLE, USS WALLER (Screen Commander, Commander THOMPSON), and USS SAUFLEY.

Entered Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima, Nansei Shoto, at 0723 and proceeded to fuel. Anchored at 1132.

September 7 Anchored in Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima, Nansei Shoto. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Division ONE HUNDRED FOUR in USS HAMUL).

Fueled during the afternoon. Underway at 1714 in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE dispatch 070043. Enroute to the mouth of the Yangtze River, China, Steaming singly.
September 8 Steaming singly enroute from Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima to the mouth of the Yangtze River, China.

September 9 Steaming singly enroute from Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima to the mouth of the Yangtze River, China.

At 0623 anchored twelve (12) miles northeast of the Saddle Group in the approach to the Yangtze Kiang Delta, China and reported to Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO for duty. Underway at 0912 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 082235. Enroute to Bonham Strait, East of Saddle Group to assist in minesweeping operations. At 1300 anchored off Bonham Strait, Parker Islands. Underway at 1907 for night retirement from Bonham Strait in company with Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE consisting of USS SAUFLEY (Officer in Tactical Command, Lieutenant Commander SILK), USS STARLING, USS TOUCAN, USS SURFBIRD, USS SHELLDRAKE, USS SPEAR, and USS COMPETENT.

September 10 Steaming in company with Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE on night retirement from Bonham Strait, Southeast of Parker Islands. (Officer in Tactical Command, Lieutenant Commander SILK in USS SAUFLEY).

At 0659 directed commanding officer of USS STARLING to take charge of AM's and commence mine sweeping operations. At 0722 anchored off Bonham Strait, Parker Islands, China. Underway at 0928 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 09160 to rendezvous with Task Force SEVENTY THREE in vicinity Barren Islands for fueling assignment. Fueled from USS ST. LOUIS during afternoon and rejoined Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE in vicinity of Parker Islands. Made night retirement from Bonham Strait.

September ll - 25 Steaming in company with Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE (Officer in Tactical Command, Lieutenant Commander SILK in USS SAUFLEY). Conducting minesweeping operations in the vicinity of the Parker Islands at the mouth of the Yangtze River, China. Task Unit anchored at intervals.

September 26 Anchored with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE (Officer in Tactical Conmand, Lieutenant Commander SILK in USS SAUFLEY).

At 1515 relieved of duties as Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE by USS WALLER in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 250841. Underway at 1632 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 250481. Proceeding in company with USS PC 575 to anchorage in the vicinity of Bonham Light. Anchored at 1948 southeast of Bonham Light, Parker Group, China.

September 27 Anchored with USS PC 575 southeast of Bonham Island, Parker Group, China (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander SILK in USS SAUFLEY).

Underway at 1031 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 261320 to escort merchant vessels EDWARD B. HAINES and GEORGE HOLMES through Bonham Straits. At 1423 directed the EDWARD B. HAINES and GEORGE HOLMES to anchor. At 1523 anchored in the Yangtze River Delta.
September 28 Anchored in vicinity of Yangtze River entrance buoy, Shanghai, China (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander LAMIMAN in USS PHILIP).

September 29 Anchored in vicinity of Yangtze River entrance buoy, Shanghai, China (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander LAMIMAN in USS PHILIP).

Underway at 1242 in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE dispatch 280417. Proceeded up Yangtze River with River Pilot on board. Entered Whangpoo River at 1455 and proceeded to Shanghai. At 1705 moored starboard side to USS JOHNSON (DE583) in USN Buoy Berth, Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China.

September 30 Moored alongside USS JOHNSON in Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. Emergency repairs being accomplished by USS DIXIE. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS NASHVILLE).

source.name: USS SAUFLEY - Rep Of AA Action, 8/15/43

item.description:
August 1 Moored alongside USS PHILIP in San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

Underway at 0806 to refuel. Completed fueling at 1123 and proceeded to Punubulu Island for ammunition. Completed taking ammunition aboard during afternoon. Moored aloneside USS PHILIP at 1905.

August 2 Moored alongside USS PHILIP in San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

Underway at 1355 and proceeded to Tolosa in accordance with orders of Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX. Anchored at 1446. Underway at 1606 and moored alongside USS PHILIP at 1656.
August 3 Moored alongside USS PHILIP in San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

August 4 Moored alongside USS PHILIP in San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

Underway at 1025 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX dispatch 020300 for degaussing check and magnetic compass compensation. Upon completion of compass check proceeded to Guiuan during afternoon. Anchored in Guiuan Roadstead on the southeast coast of Samar Island. Philippine Islands at 1844.

August 5 Anchored in Guiuan Harbor, southeast coast, Samar, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander MALPASS in USS ROBINSON).

Underway at 0627 in accordance with visual dispatch O41000 from Officer in Tactical Command in USS ROBINSON. Proceeded with USS PHILIP to San Pedro Bay. Entered San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands at 0840 and fueled during morning. Underway at 1501 from San Pedro Bay in company with USS CONY, USS PHILIP and USS ROBINSON (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander MALPASS) in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX dispatch 050104. Proceeding to Ulithi.

August 6 Steaming enroute from Leyte, Philippine Islands to Ulithi in company with USS CONY, USS PHILIP and USS ROBINSON. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander MALPASS).

During the morning and afternoon test fired 5"/38 VT Projectiles. During the afternoon conducted surprise burst firing exercises as directed by Officer in Tactical Command.

August 7 Steaming enroute from Leyte, Philippine Islands, to Ulithi in company with USS CONY, USS PHILIP and USS ROBINSON (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander MALPASS).

Entered Ulithi and at 1249 reported to Commander Marianas Group for duty in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX dispatch 050104. Fueled during the afternoon. At 1837 moored alongside USS CONY, in Urishi Anchorage, Ulithi Island, West Caroline Islands.

August 8 Moored alongside USS CONY in Urishi Anchorage, Ulithi Island, West Caroline Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN Representative in USS PRAIRIE).

Underway from: USS CONY at 1402 and anchored at 1425 on Urishi Anchorage.

August 9 Anchored in Urishi Anchorage, Ulithi Island, West Caroline Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN Representative in USS PRAIRIE).

Underway at 1501 in accordance with Commander Task Unit NINETY FOUR POINT SIX POINT TWO dispatch 082351. Proceeding in company with USS MINNEAPOLIS to Leyte, Philippine Islands.

August 10 Steaming enroute from Ulithi to Leyte Philippine Islands in company with USS MINNEAPOLIS (Officer in Tactical Command, Captain H. B. SLOCUM).

During the morning and afternoon conducted air burst firing exercises.

August 11 Steaming enroute from Ulithi to Leyte, Philippine Islands in company with USS MINNEAPOLIS. (Officer in Tactical Command, Captain H. B. SLOCUM).

Detached from escort duty at 1140 and stood into San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands at 1228. Fueled during the afternoon. Anchored in San Pedro Bay at 1919.
August 12 Anchored in San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

August 13 Anchored in San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

Underway at 1826 in accordance with Commander Philippine Sea Frontier's Speed Letter 381-45 Serial 00764. Proceeding in company with USS GIANSAR (AK111) to Ulithi. Assumed screening station at 1935.
August 14 Steaming enroute from Leyte, Philippine Islands to Ulithi in company with USS GIANSAR. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander KING).
August 15 Steaming enroute from Leyte, Philippine Islands to Ulithi in company with USS GIANSAR. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander KING).
August 16 Steaming enroute from Leyte, Philippine Islands to Ulithi in company with USS GIANSAR. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander KING).

August 17 Steaming enroute from Leyte, Philippine Islands to Ulithi in company with USS GIANSAR. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander KING).

Detached from escort duty by USS GIANSAR at 1430. During the afternoon conducted sleeve firing exercises consisting of "Baker" and "George" runs, stood into UlLithi Harbor, Western Caroline Islands at 1717 and anchored at 174).

August 18 Anchored in Ulithi Harbor, Western Caroline Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN Representative in USS PRAIRIE).

Fueled during the morning. Received ammunition on board during the afternoon.
August 19-20 Anchored in Ulithi Harbor, Western Caroline Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN Representative in USS PRAIRIE).

August 21 Anchored in Ulithi Harbor, Western Caroline Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN Representative in USS PRAIRIE).

Underway at 0926 in accordance with Commander SEVENTH Fleet Secret Dispatch 180037 and Port Director Ulithi Routing Instructions as Escort for Ulithi-Leyte Convoy #87. Assumed screening aves at 1040. Proceeding in company with USS GENERAL M. RANDALL (Officer in Tactical Command, Captain W. R. STEVENS), SS BRAZIL and SS SEA CORPORAL.

August 22 Steaming enroute from Ulithi to Leyte, Philippine Islands in company with USS GENERAL M. RANDALL (Officer in Factical Command, Captain W. R. STEVENS), SS BRAZIL and SS SEA CORPORAL.

During the morning fired illuminating projectiles as target for USS GENERAL M. RANDALL practice fire.

August 23 Steaming enroute from Ulithi to Leyte, Philippine Islands in company with USS GENERAL M. RANDALL (Officer in Tactical Command, Captain W. R. STEVENS), SS BRAZIL and SS SEA CORPORAL.

Officer in Tactical Command dispersed convoy at 1030, Proceeded up Surigao Strait at 1103. At 1245 took departure for Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands in accordance with Port Director Homonhon's Routing Orders Serial #218 dated 23 August 1945. Steaming singly.

August 24 Steaming singly enroute from Leyte Gulf, Philippine Islands to Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands.

Entered Subic Bay at 1620 and proceeded to fuel. Anchored at 1918.
August 25-28 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY FOUR in USS ST LOUIS).
August 29 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST LOUIS).

August 30 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST LOUIS).

Assumed ready duty at 0800.

August 31 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST LOUIS).

Relieved of ready duty by USS WALLER at 0800.

July 1 Steaming enroute from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Balikpapan, Borneo with ships of Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander Task Groun SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admira NOBLE in USS WASATCH).

At 0553 Task Group commenced deployment for assaualt on Balikpapan beaches with SAUFLEY acting as one of the Screening units for transports enroute to the transport area. At 0700 fire support ship's commenced pre-landing bombardment. At 0725, all units having reached the transport area, SAUFLEY took assigned station in transport area anti-submarine screen.

July 2 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti- submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in USS WASATCH).

At 0731 detached from transport area screen by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN and directed to proceed to fire support station "Ruth" Southeast of Tokong Point, Balikpapan. Anchored in designated fire support area at 0824 and stood by to deliver call fire. At 1606 commenced firing on targets designated by Shore Fire Control Party. Ceased firing at 1708 having expended 60 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common and 3 rounds of White Phosphorous projectiles. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945).

Underway at 1850 as directed by Commander Naval Gunfire Support and proceeded to vicinity of fire support station "Lulu" and stood by to deliver harassing illumination fire.

At 2008 commenced firing on targets designated by Shore Fire Control Party. Ceased firing at 2030 having expended 62 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945). Commenced illumination fire at 2044.

July 3 Anchored on fire support station 3 miles Southeast of Tokong Point, Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in USS WASATCH). Ship delivering starshell illumination as directed by Shore Fire Control Party. Ceased firing at 0351 having expended 35 5"/38 illuminating projectiles. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945).

Enemy plane reported in area at 0441 set condition of readiness I, material condition Able. At 0625 burning plane observed falling to the South. Area clear at 0720 set condition of readiness II, material condition Baker. Before being shot down by CAP unidentified plane had made several runs across beach and transport area at high altitudes. At no time did plane come within visual range of this ship.

Relieved on fire support station at 0805 by USS FLUSSER. Underway and proceeded to transport area as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POTNT TWO POINT FIFTEEN and reported to Commander Underwater Demolition Team ELEVEN for duty. Anchored in transport area at 0931 awaiting further orders, Underway at 1150 as directed by Commander Underwater Demolition Team ELEVEN and proceeded to take station off Sepinggang to cover activities of Underwater Demolition Team.

Anchored off Sepinggang at 1218. Relieved by USS WALLER at 1231 and underway and proceeded to transport area to fuel. At 1330 Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE, shifted flag to CGC SPENCER. Upon completion of fueling at 1415 underway and proceeded to ammunition ship for replenishment. Upon completion of taking on ammunition underway and transferred mail from USS WALLER. At 1639 took patrol station in transport area screen as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN.

July 4 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti- submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in CGC SPENCER).

At 0830 proceeded to fire support station "Lulu". as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN and relieved USS PHILIP. Anchored at 1041. Standing by for call fire support.

July 5 Steaming on patrol in fire support area 5 miles Southeast of Manggar, Borneo standing by for call fire missions. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in CGC SPENCER).

At 0400 commenced firing on targets designated by Shore Fire Control Party. Ceased firing at 0425 having expended 52 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945). Unidentified aircraft reported in area during routine morning alert. Commenced firing on designated targets at 0810. Ceased firing at 0848 having expended 33 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945). Relieved of fire support duty at 0924 by USS PHOENIX.

Proceeded to patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY HIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN, Arrived on station at 1403 and commenced patrolling.

Left screening station at 1635 as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN and proceeded to fire support area off Manggar airfield. Relieved USS PHILIP at 1826 and anchored 6 miles Southeast of Manggar airfield. Commenced firing on designated targets at 1830. Completed firing at 1920 having expended 14 rounds of 5"/38 White Phosphorous and 8 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945).

July 6 Anchored in fire support area 6 miles Southeast of Manggar airfield, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in CGC SPENCER). Standing by to deliver call fire as requested by Shore Fire Control Party. At 0932 commenced firing on designated targets. Completed firing at 1351 having expended 510 rounds of AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945). At 1406 shifted anchorage 2000 yards nearer to beach. Commenced firing on designated targets at 1919. Completed firing at 1937 having expended 48 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945).

July 7 Anchored in fire support area 5 miles Southeast of Manggar airfield, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in CGC SPENCER). Standing by to deliver call fire as requested by Shore Fire Control Party.

At 0027 commenced delivering illumination fire. Ceased illumination at 0114. At 0123 commenced harassing fire as directed by Shore Fire Control Party. Completed firing at 0134 having expended 44 rounds of 5"/38 Illuminating projectiles and 48 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945). Commenced firing on designated targets at 0600. Completed firing at 0605 having expended 50 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report of 19 July 1945). Relieved of fire support duties at 0716 by USS PHILIP. Underway at 0736 and took station in transport area anti-submarine screen as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN.

At 0923 left screen and proceeded into transport area to take on ammunition as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN. Upon completion directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN to proceed to radar picket station #2. At 1330 Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN directed SAUFLEY to return from station and proceed to Manggar fire support area. Anchored 5 miles Southeast of Manggar airfield at 1452. Relieved USS CHARRETTE of fire support duty. Standing by awaiting further orders.

Commenced firing on designated targets at 1527. Completed firing at 1619 having expended 62 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. At 1750 commenced firing on new targets. Completed firing at 1759 having expended 57 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July).

At 1900 Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in CGC SPENCER departed this area. Captain GRAY, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN in USS KEY assumed duties as SOPA this area.

Underway at 1914 as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN and proceeded to assigned station in transport area anti-submarine screen. On Station at 1945 and commenced patrolling.

July 8 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

During the morning proceeded into transport area and fueled. Upon completion of fueling, rejoined screen.

July 9 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

During the morning proceeded into transport area and fueled. Upon completion of fueling rejoined the screen.

July 10 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

At 0730 directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN to proceed to fire support station "Ruth". At O840 anchored on fire support station Southeast of Tokong Point, Balikpapan. Underway at 1711 and took station in transport area screen relieving USS PHILIP. At 1830 observed a large explosion close aboard stern of LCI(G) 66 patrolling inshore. Proceeded to close in order to render assistance as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN. Damaged LCI reported he did not need our assistance as another LCI had closed to assist him. Returned to station at 1920.

At 2028 made sound contact in Northern half of patrol station. Maneuvered to develop attack and between 2033 and 2135 made five depth charge attacks. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 0443 of 11 July 1945). At 2142 USS THOMAS exchanged stations with this ship and continued to develop contact.
July 11 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

July 12 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

During the morning proceeded into the transport area and fueled. After fueling anchored 4½ miles southeast of Point Tokong as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTLEN.

Underway at 1218 and rejoined screen at 1256 in accordance with orders of Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN.
<div>July 1 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

July 14 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY). At 0642 departed station and proceeded to fire support station off Manggar as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN. Anchored on fire support station at 0725 and stood by awaiting firing orders.
July 15 & 16 Anchored 3¼ miles East Of Manggar River in fire support area awaiting firing instructions. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

July 17 Anchored 3¼ miles East of Manggar River in fire Support area awaiting firing instructions. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain Gray in USS KEY).

Underway at 0740 as directed by screen commander and proceeded into transport area to fuel. Upon completion of fueling anchored 3 miles South of Sepinggang as directed by screen commander. At 1300 Captain MEE in LST 732 relieved Captain GRAY as Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN and duties of Senior Officer Present Afloat.
July 18 Anchored 3 miles South of Sepinggang, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain MEE in LST 732).

July 19 Anchored 3 miles South of Sepinggang, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain MEE in LST 732). Underway at 1730 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN dispatch 190515. At 1818 formed up with USS CHEPATCHET and USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER) and departed Balikpapan, Borneo for Morotai, Netherlands East Indies.
July 20 Steaming enroute from Balikpapan, Borneo to Morotai, Netherlands East Indies, in company with USS CHEPATCHET and USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER).

July 21 Steaming enroute from Balikpapan, Borneo to Morotai, Netherlands East Indies, in company with USS CHEPATCHET and USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER). At 1402 USS CHEPATCHET detached and proceeded in accordance with Commander Service Force SEVENTH Fleet's dispatch 191315.

July 22 Steaming enroute from Balikpapan, Borneo to Morotai, Netherlands East Indies, in company with USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER). During the morning entered Morotai, fueled, and anchored at 0923. Reported to Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN for duty.
July 23 Anchored in Morotai, Netherlands East Indies. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN in Lot 780).

July 24 Anchored in Morotai, Netherlands East Indies, (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN in LOT 780). Underway at 1456 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN dispatch 220285. At 1543 formed Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN POINT TWENTY TWO with USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER) and departed Morotai, Netherlands East Indies for Leyte, Philippine Islands.

July 25 Steaming enroute from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Leyte, Philippine Islands in company with USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER) as Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN POINT TWENTY TWO.

July 26 Steaming enroute from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Leyte, Philippine Islands in company with USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER) as Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN POINT TWENTY TWO.

During the morning conducted sleeve firing exercises consisting of Baker and George runs. USS JOBB participated in these exercises.

Entered Leyte Gulf at 1200 and proceeded up Gulf to San Pedro Bay at 1350 and anchored off Tolosa at 1428. Reported to Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX for duty. Underway at 1650 as directed by Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX and proceeded to anchorage area off Samar. Moored port side to USS PHILIP at 1817.
July 27-31 Moored alongside USS PHILIP in San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands. Emergency repairs being accomplished by USS DIXIE. (SOPA, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

0000-0400 Steaming on base course 268 (T) speed 7 knots patrolling station, boilers 1+3 in use. 0137 On various courses + speeds conforming to channel Renard Sound. 0859 Lying to in Renard Sound screening unloading of LCT's.
0400-0800 Lying to as before. No further remarks.
0800-1200 Lying to as before.
1800-1600 Lying to as before. 1339 Underway with LCT in tow on various courses + speeds conforming to channel Renard Sound. 1414 c/c to 094 Gyro speed 10½ knots. 1430 c/c to 093 gyro. 1519 c/c to 12 knots in gradual steps.
1600-2000 Steaming as before. 1840 Made preparations for entering port; LCT cast off towing line. 1929 Anchored in 20 fathoms of water with 45 fathoms of chain to starboard. Anchor in berth A-2 Tulagi Harbor.
2000-2400 Anchored as before.

0000-0400 Anchored in berth A-2 Tulagi Harbor in 20 fathoms of water with 45 fathoms of chain to the water edge on stbd anchor Ship on two minutes notice for getting underway. Boilers 1+4 in use.
0400-0800 Anchored as before. No further remarks.
0800-1200 Anchored as before. 0815 Commenced preparations for getting underway. 0825 Reported gyro compass out of commission. 0829 Underway [] [] and speed of [] the [] 0849 c/s to 15 knots [] [] c/c to 180 [] course approaching [] ship [] [] course + speed [] for approach. 1006 Moored alongside USS George Clymer Com [] 1024 Commenced [] 1120 [] [] provisions.
1200-1600 Moored as before fueling + provisioning 1300 Completed fueling having received 94130 gals aboard draft forward 12' 00" aft 14' ft 16" 1425 Completed provisioning commenced preparations for getting underway. 1448 Underway 1518 c/c to 008 gyro speed 20 knots 1523 c/c to 003 gyro 1533 c/c to 000 gyro 1543 [] on various courses + speeds conforming to Tulagi Channel.

February 1, 1943
Proceeding in company with Task Force ELEVEN. Task Force ELEVEN consisting of SARATOGA (Commander Task Force ELEVEN - Rear Admiral D. C. Ramsey), SAN JUAN, SAUFLEY (Commander Destroyer Squadron SIX), CASE, MAURY, and MC CALL. On course and axis 015 (T), speed 20 knots in special cruising disposition 11. Operating in accordance with Commander South Pacific's Operation Order 4-43.
  • 0100 Changed front to 140 (T).
  • 0632 Sunrise.
  • 0830 U.S.S. CIMARRON and U.S.S. GRIDLEY joined formation.
  • 0900 Task Force commenced fueling operation, fueling course 135 (T), speed 10 knots.
  • 1116 Sighted Task Force SIXTY-FOUR, WASHINGTON, INDIANA, NORTH CAROLINA, and three destroyers, bearing 316 (T), distance 26,000 yards.
  • 1600 Task Force completed fueling. Formed special cruising disposition 11, on course and axis 315 (T), speed 20 knots.
  • 1936 Sunset.
  • 2000 Changed front to 340 (T).
  • 2200 Changed front to 305 (T).

February 2, 1943
Proceeding in company with Task Force ELEVEN on course and axis 305 (T), speed 20 knots, in special cruising disposition 11.
  • 0721 Sunrise.
  • 0921 Sighted U.S.S. CRAVEN bearing 295 (T), distance 26,000 yds.
  • 0945 U.S.S. CRAVEN joined formation.
  • 1035 Changed front to 055 (T).
  • 1100 Carrier based planes conducted a simulated attack on the disposition.
  • 1334 Sighted U.S.S. JENKINS bearing 035 (T), distance 24,000 yards/
  • 1954 Sunset.
  • 2300 Changed front to 060 (T).
